title: 103_s1423
content: The Medicaid Eligibility Simplification Act is referred to as the "Medicaid Eligibility Simplification Act" and includes coverage of pregnancy-related services for alien women during pregnancy. The Medicaid Eligibility Simplification Act includes coverage of pregnancy-related services for alien women during pregnancy, with payment made for care and services if the woman meets eligibility requirements for medical assistance under the State plan. The amendments made by this section apply to payments under title XIX of the Social Security Act for calendar quarters beginning on or after October 1, 1993. SEC. 3. Simplification of application process for aliens. Section 1902 is amended to allow a State to accept the signature of an adult representative of a household applying for medical assistance as sufficient for compliance with Federal law, as long as the representative certifies the truthfulness of the information provided and the eligibility of household members for assistance. The amendments made to Section 1902 allow a State to accept an adult representative's signature for medical assistance applications, with the amendments applying to applications starting on or after October 1, 1993. ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS FOR CERTAIN MONTHS IN THE CASE OF INDIVIDUALS WITH WEEKLY OR BIWEEKLY INCOME. ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS FOR CERTAIN MONTHS IN THE CASE OF INDIVIDUALS WITH WEEKLY OR BIWEEKLY INCOME. Section 1611(c) is amended to address how income received on a regular weekly or biweekly basis affects eligibility for benefits under this title. Income is to be treated as if received on a monthly basis at the same annual rate to determine eligibility for benefits. The annual rate of income received by an individual on a weekly or biweekly basis is calculated by multiplying the weekly or biweekly income by 52 or 26, respectively. The monthly income is determined by dividing the annual rate by 12. The amendments made by this section will be effective for eligibility determinations starting on or after October 1, 1993, with weekly or biweekly income involved. Optional reporting requirements under Medicaid Transitional Medical Assistance will be effective for eligibility determinations starting on or after October 1, 1993, with weekly or biweekly income involved. In General, Section 1925(b)(2)(B) (42 U.S.C. 1396r-6(b)(2)(B)) is amended to allow states the option to make changes. Conforming amendments are made to various subsections of Section 1925 (42 U.S.C. 1396r-6) to reflect this change. The amendments made by this section apply to eligibility determinations for calendar quarters beginning on or after October 1, 1993. SEC. 6 amends the definition of a qualified provider for pregnant women. SEC. 7 modifies income requirements and coverage for reproductive health services for pregnant women. These changes apply to payments under title XIX of the Social Security Act starting from October 1, 1993. Coverage for reproductive health services under Section 1902(e)(6) of the Social Security Act is amended to include continued coverage for women after pregnancy for 18 months. Reproductive health services are defined to include contraception services. The amendments to Section 1902(e)(6) of the Social Security Act expand coverage for reproductive health services, including contraception, voluntary sterilization, STD and cancer screenings, maternity care, and education. Effective October 1, 1993, these changes apply to payments under title XIX. SEC. 8 amends Section 1905(p)(1)(B) of the Social Security Act regarding Medicare premiums and cost-sharing for medically needy individuals. The effective date for these amendments is for payments under title XIX starting on or after October 1, 1993. SEC. 9 clarifies the income methodology used to determine eligibility for certain medically needy individuals for Medicaid benefits. Section 1903(f) of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new paragraph regarding income and resource eligibility determination for individuals under section 1902(a)(10)(C)(i)(III). The applicable income limitation will be compared to adjusted income after State income methodology application. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to section 1903(f)(1)(A).
